title: Frank Zappa - Road Tapes #2 (2013) 2CD (Helsinki, 1973)
description:
"
Road Tapes, Venue #2"(2013) is mix from three shows in 1973 in Helsinki, Finland, edited together to form a more-or-less complete concert. 

Joining him are longtime collaborators like Ruth and Ian Underwood and George Duke, plus some musicians whoâ€™d only be around for a couple of tours: bassist Tom Fowler and drummer Ralph Humphrey. And, for one tour only, Zappa was joined by Jean-Luc Ponty.

They twist and turn through some of Zappaâ€™s quirkier compositions, like RNDZL, Dog Breath and Echidnaâ€™s Arf (Of You). On the free-form showcase Further Oblivion, Ponty and Ian Underwood stretch out their solos, showing how talented this band was improvising. But the real standout here is Duke: he takes the vocal lead on Village of the Sun, delivers a wild keyboard solo and then leads the bandâ€™s improvisations on Dupreeâ€™s Paradise.

By turns jazzy and discordant, with Zappaâ€™s trademark â€œhumanly impossibleâ€ compositions, it is a wonderful document of one of the most celebrated of the line-ups of The Mothers.


Frank Zappa & The Mothers of Invention

Road Tapes, Venue # 2

(Finlandia Hall, Helsinki, Finland, August 23 & 24, 1973)

2013


2CDs / 2013 / VBR-V0


Track List:

Disc 1: 

1. Introcious 

2. The Eric Dolphy Memorial Barbecue
 
3. Kung Fu 

4. Penguin In Bondage 

5. Exercise #4 

6. Dog Breath 

7. The Dog Breath Variations 

8. Uncle Meat 

9. RDNZL 

10. Montana 

11. Your Teeth And Your Shoulders and sometimes your foot goes.../Pojama Predlude 

12. Dupree's Paradise 

13. All Skate/Dun-Dun-Dun (The Finnish Hit Single)

 
Disc 2: 

1. Village Of The Sun 

2. Echidna's Arf (Of You) 

3. Don't You Ever Wash That Thing? 

4. Big Swifty 

5. Father O'Blivion 

6. Brown Shoes Don't Make It 


Frank Zappa & The Mothers of Invention

Road Tapes, Venue # 2

(Finlandia Hall, Helsinki, Finland, August 23 & 24, 1973)

2013
